Reviews.Title: somewhat disappointing
Reviews.Author: Rachelle Adams
Reviews.Content: I do like this phone and in many ways it's an upgrade from my previous phone.  However, I can definitely tell it's an earlier version of the Android operating system.  I don't understand why there is no autocorrect and/or spell check in the texting application.  I checked all the setting and even downloaded the manual but in the end had to purchase an app called SwiftKey to spell check my texts. Plus, this particular phone has a glitch on the touchscreen which creates a "dead zone" in the top quarter of the screen that doesn't respond to touch.  This is very frustrating, especially with apps that do not rotate, such as Instagram.  I cannot edit my Instagram profile because the "profile" button falls right in the dead zone.  I have to rotate the phone almost all the time to access any buttons that lie in the top quadrant of the screen. Furthermore this phone has a TERRIBLE battery life, it runs out of charge in only a few hours, even if I'm barely using any apps. I guess I got what I paid for and shouldn't expect more from a used phone.

Reviews.Title: Awesome Phone
Reviews.Author: Stephen
Reviews.Content: This is the second time I've purchased this phone and I would do it a third time as well. The Evo Shift is a great and durable phone, my last one fell into the Colorado River with me and still worked for 6 Months! I love the keyboard and the 4G capability. This phone is your best bet for the price.
